alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 8:55PM CDT until April 26 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Water levels will be climbing above flood stage early Friday morning and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.8 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 04/13/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued early Friday morning.
